author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: I think that name is too generic and non descriptive. I think it would be great if the name could be changed to something that gives an idea what the package might be about.

GG is short for generalised generated.
Have you checked what the package is for? IMO it's this generic.

@thautwarm I agree it's very general. OTOH, I can see the argument that libraries to be used as dependencies by other libraries can benefit from a name that indicates the capability. And less altruistically, I'm very eager to get this through so I can start building on it :)

What do you think of `GeneralizedGenerated.jl`?

I think a good name would give me _some_ indication what the package might be about. With `GG` I have absolutely no clue. Why not go with `GeneralizedGeneratedFunctions.jl` or something like that? The moment I read that, I have a clear idea what it is about. And I assume this package won't be used much at the REPL, so a long package name also doesn't seem like a problem?

In fact, this project name comes with a pun...

@cscherrer  Can you ~~change the name of this repo~~  update the repo for this PR? I'm now busy with other stuffs.

> In fact, this project name comes with a pun...

The `@gg` macro still has good game :)

> Can you ~change the name of this repo~ update the repo for this PR? I'm now busy with other stuffs.

Think I have permissions to do this, but I'm not sure about the procedure. I'll figure it out or ask around
